text: Before the Acts of Union 1707, the barons of the shire of Lanark elected commissioners to represent them in the unicameral Parliament of Scotland and in the Convention of the Estates. The number of commissioners was increased from two to four in 1690. From 1708 Lanarkshire was represented by one Member of Parliament in the House of Commons of Great Britain. ==List of shire commissioners== {| class="wikitable" |- !Parliament or Convention!!colspan=4|Commissioners |- |Parliament 12–13 October 1612||colspan=2|Sir William Baillie of Lamington||colspan=2 rowspan=2|Sir John Hamilton of Lettrick |- |Convention 7 March 1617||colspan=2|Maxwell of Calderwood |- |Parliament 27 May–28 June 1617||colspan=2|Sir John Hamilton of Lettrick||colspan=2|Maxwell of Calderwood |- |Convention 25–26 January 1621||colspan=4|none |- |Parliament 1 June–4 August 1621||colspan=2|Maxwell of Calderwood||colspan=2|Sir John Hamilton of Lettrick |- |Convention 27 October–2 November 1625||colspan=2|Hamilton of Lettrick||colspan=2|Hamilton of Goslingtoun |- |Parliament 15 September 1628 – 28 June 1633||colspan=2|Sir James Lockhart, yr of Lee||colspan=2|Gavin Hamilton of Raploch |- |Convention 28 July–7 August 1630||colspan=2|Gavin Hamilton of Raploch||colspan=2|Sir James Lockhart, yr of Lee |- |Parliament 15 May 1639 – 17 November 1641||colspan=4 rowspan=4| |- |Convention 22 June 1643 – 3 June 1644 |- |Parliament 4 June 1644 – 27 March 1647 |- |Parliament 2 March 1648 – 6 June 1651 |- |colspan=5|During the Commonwealth of England, Scotland and Ireland, the sheriffdom of Lanark was represented by one Member of Parliament in the Protectorate Parliament at Westminster. |- |Parliament 3 September 1654 – 22 January 1655||rowspan=3 colspan=4|William Lockhart |- |Parliament 17 September 1656 – 4 February 1658 |- |Parliament 27 January–22 April 1659 |- |colspan=5|After the Restoration, the Parliament of Scotland was again summoned to meet in Edinburgh. |- |Parliament 1 January 1661 – 9 October 1663||rowspan=4 colspan=2|Sir James Lockhart of Lee||colspan=2|Sir Robert Hamilton, 1st Baronet of SilvertonhillG.
